intro: Mayna sericea, commonly known as silky mayna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, round berries. Mayna sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
